channel.title: My Client Can't run Windows 7
channel.description:
Does anyone know how I can make my client able to run on Windows 7?
Thanx.

item.title: My Client Can't run Windows 7
item.dc:creator: @FusionLord FusionLord
item.description:
@FusionLord wrote:

[quote=“Phaze One, post:4, topic:338819”][quote author=FusionLord link=topic=435206.msg3196208#msg3196208 date=1272821662]
YEAH, add this code to the top of your compiler,

if exist "c:\program filesx86\Java" (call :compile "c:\program filesx86\Java\") else (goto error)
:compile
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe")
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)

it should work if not let me know.
[/quote]

Absolutely no clue what that is?

Post your original batch file and I can help.[/quote]

This makes it so you don’t need inviromental
variables and it will work regardless of the
version of java installed

Read full topic

it should work if not let me know.[/quote]

Post your original batch file and I can help.

item.title: My Client Can't run Windows 7
item.dc:creator: @FusionLord FusionLord
item.description:
@FusionLord wrote:

YEAH, add this code to the top of your compiler,

if exist "c:\program filesx86\Java" (call :compile "c:\program filesx86\Java\") else (goto error)
:compile
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe")
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)

it should work if not let me know.
